text:
- Tire manufacturing is
highly capital-intensive,

and we felt that our return
on those capital employed
was below our peers in the industry.
So there wasn't really a real true
insights into the business,

the real end-to-end
insights into the business.

The business was very siloed,
so we needed to use data
to bring them together from our vendors,
our partners there, all the way
to customers through the supply chain.
So data was a key enabler there.

We felt that AWS as a
partner, as a technology,
was core to helping solve those problems.

First and foremost, what we
did was to build a data lake,
and we created what we call a IoT in a box
using AWS end-to-end technologies.
We call it the IoT in a box,
because we wanted standardization
and we were able to then just roll out

that pretty quickly
across all our factories
and across the key machines.

The other big thing that we
did to solve the problem was

to move SAP into SA, what
we call SAP RISE on AWS,

which is SAP-managed services
hosted on the AWS cloud.
We've moved more than 120 SAP applications
across onto AWS cloud.
So the connectivity, the security aspect
of it has been enhanced significantly,

and we are able to use data
from multiple applications

to better, you know, to
improve our business processes.

One of the biggest benefits
we've seen is close to 6
to 7% increase in machine efficiency.
We are generating more than 6% extra tires
coming out of our plants.
So that's a big improvement.

It's a huge benefit in terms
of return on capital employed.
(upbeat music)
